channel.title: Dave Job Postings
channel.description: Job postings for Dave from lever.co

item.title: Tier 2 Gaming Moderation - Onsite Only - Sacramento Ops Center (2180)
item.description:
ModSquad has partnered with multiple top tier brands/clients across the globe and we need the best of the best in Tier 2 Gaming Moderation!
Do you have a Moderation background?
If you want the chance to work gigs on the coolest of client projects...then ModSquad is the place for you!! Our clients are strictly Top Tier whose product offerings and services are hip, contemporary and very current. You will instantly know who they are and very likely use them yourselves. Their customers expect the best service and support and that's where we come in.
Our Mods bring super skills, a positive attitude and great vibe to project work everyday. Mods assist and guide customers to the right answers, solve concerns and are the GPS for customers to understand and optimize the best use of a client's product or services. Project gigs available now and more are on the horizon.
Love Gaming? Join This Team!
Seeking content moderation experts to provide services for a great, well-known gaming client. If you are interested in joining a fun, flexible, fulfilling team working with video game moderation -- read on!
ModSquad is looking for Tier 2 Mods to work out of the Sacramento, California office, providing moderation of reported content from the PlayStation network.
Hours (all times Pacific): 10 pm-7 am & 3 pm -12 am Friday-Monday (Saturdays a MUST)
Weekly commitment: 25 hours per week Weekends required (Friday - Sunday)
Language: English

ModSquad is looking for Tier 2 Mods to work out of the Derry, Northern Ireland office, providing moderation of reported content from the client's network.
Hours (all times Pacific): 10 pm-7 am & 5 am-11 am Friday-Monday (Saturdays a MUST)
Weekly commitment: 25 hours per week Weekends required (Friday - Sunday)

item.title: Tier 2 Customer Support - Sports Network (2292)
item.description:
ModSquad has partnered with multiple top-tier brands/clients across the globe and we need the best of the best in Customer Support!
Do you have a Customer Support background? Do you enjoy work-from-home and flexible schedules? Do you spend your evenings watching your favorite baseball, hockey, and football games?
Apply to this exciting opportunity today!
ModSquad is currently seeking experienced Customer Support Representatives to support one of our favorite regional Sports Networks. As a member of this team, you will respond to customer inquiries via inbound phone calls, emails, and live chats (inbound messages).
Project Hours (All Times Pacific): Monday - Friday 7 am to 5 pm
Hourly Rate: To be discussed in the interview phase
Commitment: 9 hours per week 90 days (as needed)
Language: English

item.title: Technical Integrations Developer (Front End)
item.description:
ModSquad’s Information Technology department is looking for a Technical Integrations Developer to focus primarily on Front-End development. This individual will be primarily responsible for assisting the team with creating attractive user interfaces and experiences within our internal and external systems. To support this work, they may also utilize a low code automation solution to further develop projects they’re working on, though more intricate development will be handled by others. They will work as part of the Enterprise Applications team and as a direct contributor on our SaaS tool implementations team.
What you will do: ● Work with vendors, clients, and internal teams to design, test, document, and implement UI/UX solutions on a multitude of systems, and perhaps our own website. ● Understand stakeholder stated and unstated needs to provide, design, and modify solutions to meet their expectations ● Work with clients consultatively on projects assigned, most frequently UI customization of SaaS applications like Zendesk. ● Take inspiration and feedback from our Marketing team to develop consistent UI/UX standards and processes. ● Identify and document common patterns and best practices ● Participate in active discussions with the Enterprise Applications team at large to ensure all parties are aligned on desired results and current status. ● Assist with identifying opportunities to improve user experience wherever possible, particularly as it applies to the look and feel of our technology.
Skills and Experience - Who you are: ● Bachelor’s degree in computer science/a related discipline or the equivalent work experience and technical training ● 3+ years of experience working with web design user experience and interface utilizing, but not limited to, HTML, CSS, JavaScript,and jQuery ● Experience with graphic design applications such as Adobe Illustrator. ● Experience with responsive and adaptive design. ● The ideal candidate also has a working knowledge of APIs and their utilization in designing applications that work alongside their fantastic interfaces. ● Experience in dynamic environments where technologies in use aren’t always controllable a significant plus ● Excellent time management, organizational, and communication skills ● Strong sense of personal accountability and the ability to work independently ● High EQ and Sense of humor are required

Do you have a creative mind as well as a deep understanding of online communities and social media? ModSquad is seeking a Social Media Engagement Moderator with experience and passion for gaming communities to join our team.
As a ModSquad Social Media Engagement Moderator, you will provide social media engagement on Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram, as well as the game Forums. This will also include some minor moderation on Discord, but the focus will be on engagement.
Availability: Late nights, primarily between 10pm-12am PST, weekends included.
Commitment: 10 hours per week 90 days

item.title: Senior Manager - Finance & Accounting-(2323)
item.description:
Are you looking to take the next step in your career in accounting? Looking to join a winning team, that works hard while still having fun?
Do you want to work with a state of the art cutting edge accounting SAAS software solution?
Are you looking to work in a progressive and dynamic company with great people and A-list clients?
Due to continued growth, we have an excellent opportunity for a United States based CPA to join ModSquad in a work from home situation. Reporting to the Senior Director of Finance & Accounting this will be a diverse role with a great chance of progression!

item.title: Sales Manager - Europe/UK-Based
item.description:
Are you interested in uncapped earning potential? Are you a high-energy sales professional looking to join a creative, industry leader? Do you want to work with an elite sales team that is professional, dedicated, hungry, & scrappy.
ModSquad is currently seeking a B2B Sales Manager to join our crew to continue support heavy hitting logos across a variety of industries while driving revenue forward. This position reports to the VP of Sales with responsibility for sales to all market levels. ModSquad has a great track record of growth but 2020 and 2021 have been blockbuster record years. How many organizations can say that?
ModSquad’s a global leader in the remote workforce model, so we are positioned for success in today’s new world. We support top global brands such as NFL, National Geographic, Kroger, ShipStation, DFW Airport, Electronic Arts (EA), Wooga, Children’s Miracle Network, and many more. Do you want to join a dynamic team where you can make an impact with uncapped commissions…then apply now!
Hours: Standard business hours; more as needed

item.title: Sales Director - UK/Europe
item.description:
ModSquad is looking for a sales dynamo to join our European team as a Sales Director. This position reports to the VP of Sales EU with responsibility for sales to all market levels across a variety of industry verticals. This is a work-from-home position ideal for someone based in the UK.
You have the ability to quickly understand a client’s business across a multitude of verticals and demonstrate the value of our offering. You are an ace at hunting; willing to conduct cold calls as well as farm existing accounts to aggressively foster our growth. You enjoy owning the entire sales process from initial point of contact, through to contract negotiation and deal closure. You can juggle many sales tasks at the same time and are tech savvy. You are extremely proficient in Excel as it relates to cost modeling. Experience with Salesforce is highly desired.

item.title: Sales Director (US Based - Remote)
item.description:
Are you a high-energy sales professional looking to join a creative, industry leader? Do you want to accelerate your career growth? You need to stop thinking about the day one stuff. Instead think year one and beyond.
If you are interested, here’s what year one with us is all about. Developing new clients, building your book of business that will keep on giving for years to come. Realistically, we need someone who is a hunter/farmer who is open to learn our processes. Beside a solid base salary, this position is structured with uncapped commission to attract the best of the best.
ModSquad is currently seeking a Sales Director to join our crew to continue driving forward. This position reports to the VP of Sales with responsibility for sales to all market levels. ModSquad has a great track record of growth but 2020 and 2021 have been blockbuster record years.
ModSquad is a global leader in the remote workforce model, so we are positioned for success in today’s new world. We support top global brands such as NFL, National Geographic, Kroger, ShipStation, DFW Airport, Electronic Arts (EA), Wooga, Children’s Miracle Network, and many more. If this is your DNA, apply now!
Hours: Standard business hours; more as needed

item.title: Recruiter/Sourcer, Remote (Based in Mexico/Colombia/Brazil)
item.description:
Come and join an Award Winning company and our Recruiting Team while working from your home!!
We are looking for a remote recruiter with verifiable recruiting experience in the the Latam and USA region.
If you are an experienced recruiter looking to work with a fun global digital engagement company, this might be the position for you!
The successful candidate comes with a high volume recruiting experience in multiple languages. The recruiter is expected to have a strong cultural awareness, in-dept knowledge of global demographics and the ability to operate in a tight deadline environment. The candidate will also be proficient in collecting, tracking and managing the data through trackers in real time.
In this role you will be responsible to source, qualify, interview and onboard prospective Mod Contractors for MSQ client projects across various global regions in multiple languages and markets. These recruiting assignments normally call for identifying the candidates in the following skill areas: moderation, chat, tickets and Tier1/Tier2 skill sets.
You will serve as a ModSquad ambassador, representing ModSquad brand in the market place and be able to communicate a powerful contractor/employee value proposition. You will provide and manage an exceptional candidate experience.
ModSquad is an Award Winning Customer service organization and have a culture that is committed to providing excellence in the Customer Support field. The selected candidate will live up to these standards.
Successful candidate is a bilingual speaker of English (professional level) and Spanish or Brazilian Portuguese languages.

item.title: Mod Contractor
item.description:
Mods are pros in digital engagement: moderating forums, chatting with customers, managing communities, and buzzing in social media. As a Mod in our network, you can work from any private location with secure high-speed internet access. You'll select your projects based on YOUR passions - and schedule when YOU want to deliver. #modsnotcubes
As a Mod in our network, you'll have the freedom and flexibility of working from any private, secure and noiseless location, when you want to work.
Control your own journey by being in charge of your own business, selecting your own digital engagement projects.
Get experience working with some of the coolest brands in the world, from gaming to e-commerce to entertainment.
Keep your day job! Our network is teaming with moonlighters, plus enterprising stay-at-home parents, students and retirees.
Our Mods are passionate and absolutely love working with us. Join the movement!
Want to learn more about this freelance business opportunity? Click here for all the juicy deets on performing digital engagement services as an independent contractor with ModSquad.

item.title: Lead Technical Integrations Developer
item.description:
ModSquad’s Information Technology department is looking for a Lead Technical Integrations Developer to manage a small team of developers while also acting as an individual contributor to their own projects. This individual will be responsible for balancing the team’s workload, setting and achieving reasonable delivery timelines, and supporting the overall team’s growth as we continue to establish best practices for development within our organization. They will work as part of the Enterprise Applications team and as a direct contributor on our SaaS tool implementations team.
ModSquad’s Technical Integrations team is charged holistically with assisting in automating processes and improving the user experience across all of our systems. Their ultimate goal is to ensure as little manual effort is required on processes that can be safely and effectively automated, leaving humans to do the important work that isn’t so easily repeatable or logically understood by such processes.
What you will do: ● Manage our development team using agile project management methodologies to ensure deliverables are met and on time, expectations are reasonably set, and workloads are well balanced to ensure everyone is happy with both the quality and quantity of work performed with a strong emphasis on avoiding crunch culture. ● Develop, test, troubleshoot, and maintain automation and process improvement solutions utilizing cloud-based technologies. ● Develop standards and processes to support and facilitate development projects and initiatives ● Work with vendors, clients, and internal teams to design, test, document, and implement solutions on a multitude of internal and external systems. ● Understand stakeholder stated and unstated needs to provide, design, and modify solutions to meet their expectations ● Work with clients consultatively on projects assigned as needed. ● Participate in active discussions with the Enterprise Applications team at large to ensure all parties are aligned on desired results and current status. ● Assist with identifying opportunities to improve all aspects of user experience and the company’s scalability wherever possible.
Skills and Experience - Who you are: ● Bachelor’s degree in computer science/a related discipline or the equivalent work experience and technical training ● 3+ years of experience working with web-based architecture utilizing, but not limited to, ASP.NET, C/C++, C#, jQuery, HTML, CSS, Java / J2EE / JavaScript, JSON, 3rd Party API Utilization ● 3+ years of experience working with web design user experience and interface utilizing, but not limited to, HTML, CSS, and other web development technologies. ● Significant experiencing supervising a team of technical professionals and a proven track record of delivering on set expectations. ● Experience with agile project management methodologies ● Significant experience utilizing 3rd Party APIs to integrate systems and establish creative custom solutions to a business’s needs. ● Fluent in the creation of stored procedures, functions, and views ● Competency with XML constructs, XSD and schemas ● Experience with industry leading SaaS technologies like Zendesk, Okta, Slack, G Suite, and Asana ● Experience in dynamic environments here technologies in use aren’t always controllable, like client services, a significant plus ● Excellent time management, organizational, and communication skills ● Strong sense of personal accountability and the ability to work independently ● High EQ and Sense of humor are required

On this project, we are seeking experienced Customer Support agents to assist customers via inbound/outbound phone calls with possibly a ticket and chat shift. Coverage will primarily be phone calls to assist customers with updating their accounts, making a payment, setting up autopay, answering general questions, and delivering services specific to which loan they have. Growing is the key here to this project so we are looking for those who are self-starters and unafraid to Embrace Change.
Project Hours (All Times Pacific): Monday - Sunday, 6 am - 6 pm
Especially Seeking Availability: 6 am - 2 pm, Monday - Friday 11 am - 1 pm, 12 pm - 2pm, 1 pm - 3pm
Hourly Rate: To be discussed in the interview phase
Commitment: 30 hours per week 90 days (as needed)

item.title: Corporate Counsel (2229)
item.description:
Corporate Counsel (United States / Careers – Legal / Full Time)
ModSquad provides on-demand customer experience services via remote teams around the world, and we are looking for a talented Corporate Counsel to drive our legal matters in our operations departments. Working on a legal team led by the COO | General Counsel, the Corporate Counsel will focus on negotiating complex sales and partnership agreements and providing legal support for our other departments. This role is a great opportunity for an attorney who is enthusiastic, collaborative, has good judgment and is able to navigate a fast-paced online work environment. ModSquad has operations in Austin, Northern California, Northern Ireland, San José (Costa Rica), and Manila, but most people in the company work remotely. This position is a work-from-home job for a U.S.-based lawyer.

item.title: Content Writer (2244)
item.description:
ModSquad has partnered with multiple top tier brands and clients across the globe and we need the best of the best for our Content Marketing Manager!
Availability: This is a full-time exempt level position
What You'll Do: You’ll be responsible for planning, developing, and implementing our content pipeline.
You’ll strategize and project manage, but mostly you’ll be writing!
We’re looking for someone to write typical B2B content – blog posts, case studies, email, e-books, etc. – that doesn’t read like your typical (terrible) B2B content. And you’ll do this while avoiding all the traps and tropes common to the genre. You’ll resist the easy cliche, the empty jargon, and the overwrought sentence. You’ll aim for more than vapid generalizations and sophomoric insights. You’ll write things that are clear and conversational, interesting and useful.

item.title: Community Manager
item.description:
Do you have a creative mind as well as a deep understanding of online communities and social media?
ModSquad is seeking an experienced Community Manager with knowledge and passion for building communities.
As a ModSquad Community Manager, you will work closely with our clients as well as a global ModSquad team. You will be imperative in building, maintaining, improving, and empowering our clients and their digital communities.
This is a full-time position.

item.title: Business Development Manager - Europe
item.description:
We are looking for a sales dynamo to join our European team as a Business Development Manager. This position reports to the VP of Sales EU with responsibility for sales to SMEs and Mid-Market organizations across a variety of industry verticals. This is a work-from-home position ideal for someone based in the UK.
You have the ability to quickly understand a client’s business across a multitude of verticals and demonstrate the value of our offering. You are an ace at hunting; willing to conduct cold calls as well as farm existing accounts to aggressively foster our growth. You enjoy owning the entire sales process from initial point of contact, through to contract negotiation and deal closure. You can juggle many sales tasks at the same time and are tech savvy (a Salesforce.com/Excel/Word ninja preferred).
